description: First attested in 1799–1802; back-formation from syllabification; compare the Old French sillabifier.

verbs.description: syllabify (third-person singular simple present syllabifies, present participle syllabifying, simple past and past participle syllabified)

entries.meaning: To divide a word into syllables; to syllabicate; to syllabize.
examples: A method alſo of teaching the learners “to ſyllabify with the counters” is pointed out.
